parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel system can cause a fire, which can lead to serious injury or death, as well as damage to the vehicle.
The failure of the front brake master cylinder can cause the front brakes to lock up, leading to loss of vehicle control, accidents, and potential injuries.
symptoms: fluid return valve in master cylinder is plugged
brake pads and rotors need to be replaced.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Bent or failed brake caliper pins can cause uneven brake wear, reduced braking performance, and potentially lead to accidents.
symptoms: brake pads need to be replaced

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of the welds between the heating core and hose attaching tubing can cause coolant to leak into the vehicle, leading to engine damage, overheating, and potential accidents.
A loose power steering mounting bracket can cause the vehicle to shake or vibrate, leading to loss of vehicle control and potential accidents.
symptoms: Vehicle shakes or vibrates when put into reverse
power steering mounting bracket becomes loose.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A broken front engine mount can cause the engine to rock back and forth, leading to engine damage, reduced vehicle performance, and potential accidents.

The failure of the heater core and hose can cause coolant to leak into the vehicle, leading to fogged windows, reduced visibility, and difficulty driving, especially in cold weather. This can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: windows fog up during cold weather
difficulty driving due to reduced visibility.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering mounting bracket connection can cause the engine to rock back and forth, leading to loss of control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: Power steering mounting bracket connection becomes extremely loose
engine rocks back and forth when switching between reverse and drive.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering column can cause loss of control, making it difficult to steer the vehicle, which can increase the risk of accidents.
The failure of the transmission and drivetrain can cause difficulty shifting gears, loss of control, and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: vehicle shakes or chatters when put into reverse
hard to control when moving the gear selector into first gear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front engine mount can cause the engine to rock back and forth, leading to severe engine shaking, and potentially causing damage to other engine components or surrounding structures, which can lead to costly repairs and potentially leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The engine rocks back and forth
the engine bangs under the side of the hood
difficulty switching between reverse and drive gears.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the engine exhaust system can cause black thick smoke to blow out of the exhaust unit, indicating a potential engine problem, which can lead to decreased engine performance, decreased fuel efficiency, and potentially cause damage to other engine components or surrounding structures.
symptoms: Black thick smoke blowing out of the exhaust unit

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the 5-speed manual transmission can cause the vehicle to shake, making it difficult to control, and may lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: clutch chatter when putting the vehicle into reverse
inability to shift into first gear while the vehicle is moving
requiring the vehicle to be nearly stopped before shifting into first gear.
